com.threerings.media
Class VirtualMediaPanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              com.threerings.media.MediaPanel
                  com.threerings.media.VirtualMediaPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
FrameParticipant, MediaConstants, MediaHost, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
MisoScenePanel
public class VirtualMediaPanel
extends MediaPanel

Extends the base media panel with the notion of a virtual coordinate system. All entities in the virtual media panel have virtual coordinates and the virtual media panel displays a window into that virtual view. The panel can be made to scroll by adjusting the view offset slightly at the start of each tick and it will efficiently copy the unmodified view data and generate repaint requests for the exposed regions.

See Also:
Serialized Form

CENTER_ON_PATHABLE

public static final byte CENTER_ON_PATHABLE
The code for the pathable following mode wherein we keep the view centered on the pathable's location.

The code for the pathable following mode wherein we ensure that the marked pathable is always kept within the visible bounds of the view.

Method Detail

setBackground

setViewLocation

public void setViewLocation(int x,
                            int y)
Sets the upper-left coordinate of the view port in virtual coordinates. The view will be as efficient as possible about repainting itself to achieve this new virtual location (meaning that if we need only to move one pixel to the left, it will use Graphics.copyArea(int, int, int, int, int, int) to move our rendered view over one pixel and generate a dirty region for the exposed area). The new location will not take effect until the view is MediaPanel.tick(long)ed, so only the last call to this method during a tick will have any effect.

getViewBounds

public Rectangle getViewBounds()
Returns the bounds of the viewport in virtual coordinates. The returned rectangle must not be modified.

Overrides:
getViewBounds in class MediaPanel

setFollowsPathable

public void setFollowsPathable(Pathable pable,
                               byte followMode)
Instructs the view to follow the supplied pathable; ensuring that the view's coordinates are adjusted according to the follow mode.

Parameters:
pable - the pathable to follow.
followMode - the strategy for keeping the pathable in view.

clearPathable

public void clearPathable()
Clears out the pathable that was being enclosed or followed due to a previous call to setFollowsPathable(com.threerings.media.util.Pathable, byte).
